citeinfo.title: Historical 15 minute series USGS Map Collection for Pennsylvania

idinfo.datacred: Historian Christopher Marshall and others who scanned and compiled the collection, MapTech for hosting the collection online, and PASDA for combining and registering the images for GIS use.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 4; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.535

attracc.attraccr: USGS digital raster graphics (DRG's) normally use a standard palette to ensure uniform color throughout a particular map series. This is to ensure that a particular color will remain consistent thoughout a DRG series. For these raster images derived from the MapTech Historical collection at http://historical.maptech.com, there is no guarantee given for consistent colors. This is due to the fact that images downloaded from the collection as jpegs had a 16 million color resolution, and after being combined, were reduced by an optimal best match method to 256 color (8 bit) depth.

dataqual.logic: Great care was taken by eye to seam together the four separate jpeg images that were scanned for each topographic map at library sites. Because of small levels of inaccuracy due to image rotation or scanner operation, there are varying amounts of error at seams where the images line up. As other methods of lining up images automatically through software become available, some of these historical map images may be redone and replaced.

srcinfo.srccontr: Maps scanned at library sites to produce digital images.

procstep.procdesc: Scanned USGS 15 minute quadrangle jpeg images were downloaded from the MapTech Historical Map Collection website (http://historical.maptech.com). Each full map had previously been scanned into four separate images at a library site. The jpeg images were then carefully assembled into whole map images through the use of Paint Shop Pro software. The whole map jpeg images were then converted to tiff images and reduced in color resolution to 256 colors. Finally, using Arc/Info software, the tiff images were registered and rectified to UTM Zone 17 or 18, NAD 83.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

cntinfo.cntinst: Through a connection established by Maptech employee Ed Lecuyer, Chris Marshall approached Maptech to host the MapTech Historical Map collection. Other contributors include Stephen Titchenal and Derrick Brashear. If you would like to help expand this collection, contact Chris Marshall through Maptech's e-mail address: sales@maptech.com.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
